meanings.definition: A type of mineral that is elastic and can be stretched.
meanings.sent1: The elaterites found in the mine were known for their stretchiness.
meanings.sent2: Miners discovered a vein of elaterites that could be stretched like rubber.
meanings.sent3: The elaterites decided to have a race to see who could stretch the farthest.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like elaterites, always able to stretch to accommodate others.
meanings.sent5: The children played with the elaterites, amazed at how far they could stretch it.

meanings.definition: A substance that is used in making varnishes and paints.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed the elaterites into the paint to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent2: Hardware stores sell elaterites for those who want to make their own varnish.
meanings.sent3: The elaterites in the paint seemed to dance on the canvas as it dried.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like elaterites, adding a shiny layer of meaning to his life.
meanings.sent5: The elaterites in the varnish made the wood gleam like a polished mirror.

meanings.definition: A material that is used in the construction of buildings.
meanings.sent1: The builders used elaterites to reinforce the walls of the new structure.
meanings.sent2: Elaterites were essential in creating the sturdy foundation of the skyscraper.
meanings.sent3: The elaterites in the bricks seemed to whisper secrets of ancient buildings.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like elaterites, holding him steady through life's storms.
meanings.sent5: The elaterites in the concrete made the building as strong as a fortress.
